title: Update contributing.md to use yarn.
body:
The current contributing.md instructions are outdated since the project uses yarn.

The problem:
Without installing yarn we have the following error/output:

`lerna ERR! yarn run prepublish exited ENOENT in 'next-server'`

Adding new instructions on how to install and run the project.

title: next-css in production
body:
Hello guys, can you help me understand something please :)

so my app was referencing multiple css (located in a `static/css`) in one of my layout component:
```
<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="/static/css/app.css" />
<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="/static/css/part-one.css" />
and many more
```
 this works as expected.

Now I'm in the process of optimizing my application, and want to merge/minify all the file into one. `next-css` seems to me the way to go. Instead of referencing them via multiple `Link` tag, I imported them directly : 

```
import '../static/css/app.css'
import '../static/css/part-one.css'
etc ...
```

running next in `dev` mode works fine. It looks like nextjs automatically inject the css via `<link rel="stylesheet" href="/_next/static/css/styles.chunk.css">` in the page. works great.

But in `production` mode, nothing. The css is not injected in the page, or maybe it is (but can't find it), but it results with no css applied.  

I would assume next would bundle everything for me, and auto inject the css (like in dev mode). Is that not the case ? What did I missed ? Am I stupid ? :)

Thanks for your help

info:
- "next": "^7.0.2"
- "@zeit/next-css": "^1.0.1
- running next in server mode, not directly via the `next` command

title: Cannot download via curl
body:
# Examples bug report
Download manually curl

## Example name
I run:
curl https://codeload.github.com/zeit/next.js/tar.gz/canary | tar -xz --strip=2 next.js-canary/examples/form-handler

## Describe the bug
Curl shows this message:
Error opening archive: Failed  to open '\\.\tape 0'
Failed to connect to codeload.github.com port 443: Connected refused

## System information
 - OS: Win10

title: Stuck at random stages of building
body:
# Bug report

## Description
When I want to build my app (completed [Nextjs guide](https://nextjs.org/learn) minus last 3 lessons) and run `npm run build` it completes the server, then is always stuck at one point for the client (always past 60%).

## To Reproduce
Clone https://github.com/FreeLineTM/next.js-stuck-build.
Run `npm install` and then `npm run build`.

## Expected behavior
Build to complete and be ready for production.

## System information
 - OS: Ubuntu 18.04 Windows Subsystem for Linux
 - Version of Next.js: 7.0.2

title: update && optimize with-ant-design-less example
body:
Current with-ant-design-less example has some problems.

- Upgrade next7, console found a 404 error.
![](https://user-gold-cdn.xitu.io/2018/11/11/167015fb80017e79?w=2606&h=1000&f=jpeg&s=124801)
  > After upgrade next7, .next folder didn't find /static/style.css and there is /static/css/style.chunk.css.
- The /_next/static/style.css link don't need be placed in the <Head> tag. The style.chunk.css file will be add in the head tag automatically after build.
- The project with more pages include _app.js, _document.js...the antd-custom.less will not work well.
  > The solution is use `modifyVars` of  `lessLoaderOptions`. It work well in my project~

title: Create akil
Cannot find module for _error.js
body:
# Bug report

Deploying Next to a Firebase function, gets the following error:
```
{ Error: Cannot find module '/srv/next/server/static\vk8cHgwKqiKyVYwLtSV~e\pages\_error.js'
    at Function.Module._resolveFilename (module.js:547:15)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:474:25)
    at Module.require (module.js:596:17)
    at require (internal/module.js:11:18)
    at _callee$ (/srv/node_modules/next/dist/server/require.js:85:46)
    at tryCatch (/srv/node_modules/regenerator-runtime/runtime.js:62:40)
    at Generator.invoke [as _invoke] (/srv/node_modules/regenerator-runtime/runtime.js:288:22)
    at Generator.prototype.(anonymous function) [as next] (/srv/node_modules/regenerator-runtime/runtime.js:114:21)
    at asyncGeneratorStep (/srv/node_modules/@babel/runtime-corejs2/helpers/asyncToGenerator.js:5:24)
    at _next (/srv/node_modules/@babel/runtime-corejs2/helpers/asyncToGenerator.js:27:9) code: 'MODULE_NOT_FOUND' }
```

## Describe the bug

I think this is because there's a mix of slashes and backslashes in the file name so Node can't find it. 

The file definitely exists in the correct folder.

## System information
 - OS: Windows
 - Version of Next.js: 7.0.2

## Additional context

Would it make sense to replace all backslashes with slashes in the getPagePath function?

title: Error not showing in browser + not reloading
body:
# Bug report

## Describe the bug

I'm getting an 'Internal Server Error' instead of an error page. After I correct the error, I need to manually reload the page

## To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior, please provide code snippets or a repository:
1. Go to 'https://codesandbox.io/s/xv70oz60qo'
2. There's a mistake (on purpose), on index.js, Items.
3. The 'Internal server error' page shows up
4. When I correct the error, I need to manually reload.

## Expected behavior
I've seen that similar errors show up like this:
![capture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8533385/48305946-058b7e00-e512-11e8-956f-6f81ad643207.PNG)

## System information
 - OS: Windows 10
 - Browser: Chrome
 - Version of Next.js: 7.0.0


Thank you so much for an awesome library!!

title: Firebase user data
body:
# Example bug report ## Example name with-firebase-authentication-app ## Describe the bug I want to display user displayName if user exists. I firstly render the page without the user data, then it render with it. ## To Reproduce Steps to reproduce the behavior, please provide code snippets or a repository: 1. Go to pages/index.js 2. Add `

Hello {user.displayName}

` after the check if there's a user in the render ## Expected behavior Don't render the page until user data isn't get. ## Screenshots That's what is happening when I reload the page: ![sans titre](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14930937/48304647-2e654080-e51d-11e8-9fad-e759eab8bcac.gif) ## System information - OS: macOS - Browser: Chrome 70.0.3538.77 - Version of Next.js: 7.0.2

title: Follow best SEO practices for 404 page
body: We are running https://www.onepixel.com/ through an SEO audit, I have learned that it's best practice to add a **noindex** on 404 pages.

title: Reload after new deployment
body:
Here is a quote from [deployment wiki](https://github.com/zeit/next.js/wiki/Deployment#why)

> We generate a unique BUILD_ID for each time when you run next build. We use that id to detect new versions from the client side. If the client side app detects a new BUILD_ID it'll reload the page. With that, your users will use the latest version of your app always.

Client side doesn't reload automatically after new deployment. Should I do any extra config or something to enable it?

Thank you.

title: update with-reasonml dependencies
body:
* update dependencies (remove webpack which shouldn't be there)
* be more explicit with subdir setting

title: Safari renders twice while coming back from external page
Cannot run any next.js project, issue with tapable/lib/Hook.js?
body:
##  Bug report / Describe the bug
I am getting the following error running any nextjs projects (all examples and custom nextjs apps). I believe it has to do with something outside of nextjs projects as I can run the projects when I login as any other user. I only have issues with any project where the project is placed anywhere recursively placed past my  `/Users/myusername/` directory, as it works under any other user or if project is placed here `/Users/nextjs-example`

It doesn't matter if its using the `./node_modules/.bin/next` to build or `node` (eg `node server.js`) I get the same error for every project.



```

/Users/myusername/next.js/examples/custom-server/node_modules/tapable/lib/HookCodeFactory.js:32
				fn = new Function(

RangeError: Maximum call stack size exceeded

A clear and concise description of what the bug is.

## To Reproduce

I have no idea.


## System information

title: Add crossOrigin via props to _document Head and NextScript
body: This alternative implementation of https://github.com/zeit/next.js/pull/5150 follows @timneutkens suggestion of using props.

title: ingore intelij editor files
body: These things shouldn't ever be checked in.

title: Run initializeStore() only once per route on server
body:
On the server `props.initialMobxState` received by the `constructor` is a fully functioning mobx store that was instantiated by `getInitialProps()` only a few ticks earlier.
Thus, creating a new instance is unneccessary busiwork.

In the browser, however, `props.initialMobxState` is a hydrated plain object and thus the store needs to be initialized.

title: Fix link to constants (for phases) in next readme
body: The `PHASE_*` constants seem to have moved, so I'm updating this link in the readme.

title: HMR removes CSS classes from components
body:
# Bug report

## Describe the bug

CSS Classes get removed from components when HMR loads the component again 

## To Reproduce

Just modify any component like:

```
<Component className="sarasa" />
```

And after the first HMR reload it will lose the `sarasa` class, and just keep the `jsx-xxxxxx` generated class. 

## Expected behavior

Should keep the assigned `sarasa` CSS class.

## System information
 - OS: Mojave
 - Chrome (don't think it matters)
 - Version of Next.js: 7

title: _next/static/style.css net::ERR_ABORTED 404 (Not Found)
body:
# Bug report After update version 7, is not longer working the hot reload. ## Describe the bug Not longer works the hot reload, I force to refresh manually the browser in order to update my scss (I'm using `next-sass`) ## To Reproduce Steps to reproduce the behavior, please provide code snippets or a repository: 1. `npm run dev` 2. `open browser with port defined and you will able to show the bug` ## Expected behavior After change my sass files, the browser should update their style properly. ## Screenshots This is the console log of chrome with the error: ## System information - OS: MacOs 10.13.6 - Browser chrome - Package dependencies: ``` "@zeit/next-sass": "^1.0.2-canary.0", "babel-polyfill": "^6.26.0", "classnames": "^2.2.6", "cross-fetch": "^2.2.2", "express": "^4.16.4", "fs": "0.0.1-security", "immutable": "^3.8.2", "lodash": "^4.17.10", "next": "^7.0.2-canary.21", "next-redux-wrapper": "^2.0.0", "node-sass": "4.9.4", "prop-types": "^15.6.2", "react": "^16.4.2", "react-dom": "^16.4.2", "react-notification-system": "^0.2.17", "react-redux": "^5.0.7", "redux": "^4.0.0", "redux-devtools-extension": "^2.13.5", "redux-immutable": "^4.0.0", "redux-thunk": "^2.3.0" ``` my dev dependencies: ``` "devDependencies": { "babel-core": "7.0.0-bridge.0", "babel-eslint": "^8.2.6", "babel-jest": "22.4.3", "babel-plugin-module-resolver": "^3.1.1", "chai": "^4.1.2", "enzyme": "3.2.0", "enzyme-adapter-react-16": "1.5.0", "eslint": "^4.19.1", "eslint-config-airbnb": "^17.0.0", "eslint-plugin-import": "^2.13.0", "eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y": "^6.1.1", "eslint-plugin-react": "^7.10.0", "husky": "^0.14.3", "jest": "22.0.1", "lint-staged": "^7.3.0", "prettier-eslint": "^8.8.2", "react-addons-test-utils": "15.6.2", "react-test-renderer": "16.2.0", "sinon": "^6.1.5", "superagent": "^4.0.0-beta.5", "supertest": "^3.3.0" } ``` my next.config.js ``` const withSass = require('@zeit/next-sass'); const getRoutes = require('./routes'); module.exports = { assetPrefix: process.env.NODE_ENV === 'production' ? '/{reponame}' : '', exportPathMap: getRoutes, generateBuildId: async () => { const id = process.env.BUILD_ID; return id; } }; module.exports = withSass(); ``` my _document ``` // Libs import Document, {Head, Main, NextScript} from "next/document"; export default class MyDocument extends Document { render() { return (
); } } ``` NOTE: if I remove the link import from here, seems like it works, but when I change the page, the other page is completely un-styled ## Additional context I try a lot of things, such remove node_module, npm install again, add empty style into _app, everything that I found out there, and nothing seems like works for this bug. I will really appreciate if someone have a cue about what's going on.

title: Production server breaks?
body:
# Bug report

## Describe the bug

I currently have a project where I have a custom `server.js` file for the server and it works perfect and without any errors when running `node server.js` locally. However when trying to run the server in production mode I get thrown a lot of errors (see pic below). 

Could it be because of the routing i'm doing inside the `server.js`? But why does this not happen on a development server?


## To Reproduce

[Gist of my server
](https://gist.github.com/nealoke/d90bcb08577b68695f15a9aa16047916#file-server-js)

## Expected behavior
Should work as on development server.

## Screenshots
![errors](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17417414/48256508-223f8d00-e410-11e8-8504-1650ee380451.PNG)

## System information
 - OS: `Windows`
 - Version of Next.js: `7.0.2`

title: remote: [hardsource:60012cb1] Could not freeze ./node_modules/graphql/validation/rules/FieldsOnCorrectType.mjs: Cannot read property 'hash' of undefined
body:
# Bug report

## Describe the bug

Upon attempting to deploy a next build to Heroku, the above mentioned errors are issued.

## To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior, please provide code snippets or a repository:
1. Create/amend project files
2. git add -A
3. git commit -m "production-build"
4. git subtree push --prefix sick-fits/frontend heroku-frontend master

```
> git remote -v
heroku-frontend https://git.heroku.com/flamingo-next-production.git (fetch)
heroku-frontend https://git.heroku.com/flamingo-next-production.git (push)
```

## Expected behavior
The project, as was the case up until suddenly last night, would successfully build and be deployed to Heroku.

## Screenshots
![nextjs-buiold-error](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15969262/48256111-8a897100-e406-11e8-993a-2992a27ec354.jpg)


## System information
 - OS: Windows 10 Pro
 - Version of Next.js: ^7.0.0
 - Version of next-with-apollo: ^3.1.3

## Additional context

package.json script:

```
  "scripts": {
    "dev": "next -p 7777",
    "build": "next build",
    "start": "next start -p $PORT",
    "test": "SET NODE_ENV=test&& jest --watch",
    "heroku-postbuild": "next build"
  },
```

Doing `rm -rf node_modules/.cache` as recommended in another bug report about this issue, did not resolve my issue: `https://github.com/zeit/next.js/issues/5243`

title: externals breaks monorepo
body:
# Bug report

## Describe the bug + reproduction

Say I have a mono repo with `marketing-site` (a nextjs project) and `button`, and `button/src/index.js` and `button/src/style.scss`.

I have loaders correctly set up to import scss files if they are within marketing-site, e.g. 

```js
{
  test: /\.scss$/,
  use: [
    {
      loader: 'css-loader',
      options: {
        modules: true,
      },
    },
    'sass-loader',
  ],
},
```

If, from `marketing-site`, I `import styles from '../button/src/styles.scss'`, everything works fine. However, if I import the same file from within `button/src/index.js`, it does not work.

It turns out that the culprit is the `externals` key. (I found this by comparing the two webpack configs. It was working if we were in `isServer: false` mode.)

Looks like this function https://github.com/zeit/next.js/blob/2e14b4491b555eb2a8103ffdcb76595fe3af5155/packages/next/build/webpack.js#L36 incorrectly causes the import of the scss file to not be processed by webpack.

Setting `config.externals = []` fixes the problem, it appears!

## System information
mac os

next 5.0.2. I apologize if this was fixed in a newer version.

title: next export Error: No router instance found
body:

title: Unhandled Rejection (TypeError): Cannot read property 'call' of undefined when clicking Link
body:
# Bug report

## Describe the bug

When running next.js in dev mode and clicking on a link, the error `Unhandled Rejection (TypeError): Cannot read property 'call' of undefined` until the linked page has been refreshed at least once. It seems to be related to using sass, css and typescript exports.

## To Reproduce

Follow the readme in this repository: https://github.com/leanovate/nextjs-hmr-bug

## Expected behavior
When clicking the link, the linked page appears and no error is thrown.

## Screenshots
![hmr-bug](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4339283/48205373-6bd69c00-e36c-11e8-9544-dfe4a5b41f94.gif)

![hmr-bug](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4339283/48205496-a2141b80-e36c-11e8-9adf-81b6a3adeb20.png)

## System information
 - OS: macOs
 - Browser: Chrome version 70.0.3538.77
 - Version of Next.js: 7.0.2

title: Title tag gets unset on client side
Trim buildId returned from generateBuildId
body: Fixes #5272

title: Put content of _app inside common while building webpack
body:
# Feature request
While I'm analyzing my bundle I realize that there are some packages (in my case huge momentjs with full languages) in both `_app` and in some pages. 
IMHO there are no reasons to generate _app bundle. Merging the content of _app with common would have this benefits:
 - remove 1 HTTP request for app bundle
 - packages included in app bundle could be removed from pages    

## Describe the solution you'd like
Update internal webpack config to "merge" `_app` and `commons` chunks

## Describe alternatives you've considered
In my case, I moved moment co common by adding something like this to next.config, but would be nice if it works out of the box.

```
// Add moment to commons
if (config.optimization.splitChunks.cacheGroups) {
  config.optimization.splitChunks.cacheGroups.moment = {
    test: /\/node_modules\/moment/,
    name: "commons",
    chunks: "all",
  }
}
```
